<|python_start|># Summarize transactions by category and amount (this is a simple categorization based on the transaction description)
transactions = [
    {"amount": 100.0, "subject": "Pizza party", "category": "Food"},
    {"amount": 200.0, "subject": "New year gift", "category": "Gift"},
    {"amount": 50.0, "subject": "Spotify Premium", "category": "Subscription"},
    {"amount": 1000.0, "subject": "Purchase at Apple Store: iPhone 3GS", "category": "Electronics"},
    {"amount": 10.0, "subject": "", "category": "Unknown"},
    {"amount": 1810.0, "subject": "Payment", "category": "Transfer"}
]

# Group transactions by category
categories = {}
for transaction in transactions:
    if transaction["category"] not in categories:
        categories[transaction["category"]] = []
    categories[transaction["category"]].append(transaction)

# Calculate total amount for each category
summary = {}
for category, transactions_in_category in categories.items():
    total_amount = sum(t["amount"] for t in transactions_in_category)
    summary[category] = total_amount

print(summary)<|python_end|><|eom|>assistant
